title: How has the proportion of social care users who feel safe changed?
analysis_commentary:
The Personal Adult Social Care Survey asks users how safe they feel. Users can answer: 'I feel as safe as I want', 'Generally I feel adequately safe, but not as safe as I would like', 'I feel less than adequately safe' or 'I don't feel safe at all'.

Here, we report only on those who felt as safe as they wanted to. The changes to the methodology create a break in the time series in 2014-2015 and comparison to previous years is not possible. The proportion of people who felt as safe as they wanted to in 2014-15 is 68.5%, leaving 31.5% who didn't feel as safe as they wanted to in the same year.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, Personal Adult Social Care Survey
